all_comments.video_title: Return of His Majesty | DramaBox
all_comments.text:
Guys, if you don't want spoilers, please ignore this comment.

I saw the first ad, and I ended up getting hooked, because it caught my curiosity, but I definitely don't consider it something worth watching. You may have noticed, but the script is extremely prolix, redundant and convoluted, and they turn what could be an entertaining short film into a more than 2 hours content. I watched the whole thing, and I hope this comment helps at least someone not to waste their time.

Basically, the protagonist spends almost all his time hiding the fact that he is the emperor, and his subordinates help him jn the farce, and pretend it too. The story is extremely drawn out, they practically make the dialogues repeat themselves all the time to extend the scenes as much as possible, in addition to dragging out a lot in several plots just to reinforce the cruelty of the villains. The Emperor always defends the poor and says that his ex-fianc√©e will regret everything and that the Shaws will pay. His ex-fianc√©e's sister is good and ends up being the emperor's romantic partner. After approximately 1 hour and 50 minutes of the story, he finally reveals himself to be the emperor and the villains "regret" all they did right away. His ex-fianc√©e tries to apologize and begs to be made the Empress, but it is obviously too late and he has already seen her true colors. So, after an unnecessarily long scene of him lecturing the villains, he declares that they must be executed. At the end, it shows him back in his palace and he declares that he wants to create an anti-corruption task force to prevent others from abusing the people like the Shaws did, and then the story ends.

It would have been a fun watch if the script wasn't designed to drag out the narrative as much as possible to suck the viewer's money.

all_comments.text:
This is 2 hours long. He only reveals that he's the emperor in the last 30 minutes, and I'm pretty sure half of those 30 minutes are spent with the others not believing him.

The film uses every trope imaginable to delay the revelation throughout its runtime.

It feels more like a psychological attack, deliberately designed to evoke a very specific emotion for the entire 2 hours, rather than being a movie.

I‚Äôm impressed by its shamelessness.

all_comments.video_title: Return of His Majesty | DramaBox
all_comments.text: Idk i watched it full and found it very entertaining, the amount of cringe and stupidity is just on the right level, and unlike the room, it's actually pleasant to watch. Not to mention they used so many cliche tropes that you get excited guessing which of them will they use next. It's good if you don't expect it to be serious, and i don't think it ever was meant serious at the first place.

all_comments.video_title: [MULTI SUB] Forgiveness for Love„ÄêFull„ÄëAfter backstabbing my ex, he became a bossy CEO | Drama Zone
all_comments.text: It's hard to forgive someone you truly love when they backstabbed you and put you in prison.  He lost what,  3 years of his life in prison?  Then to top it off, she hid his child away from him.  She would've kept doing it if the child was not sick.  Only when the child was stuck that the secret was out in the open.  Yes, help the child to get better but the chances of reconciliation is 0.  I wouldn't want to get back together with someone who chose her family (her parents and/or siblings) over me, either, then keep a child hidden, knowing full well that it's our child.  No thank you!  In most Asian families,  sons are favored over daughters bc sons will carry on the family name while daughters will get married and carry her husband's name, thus, she is no longer her family's daughter.  That is how most Asians see daughters.  That's why parents will go all out for their sons and leave their daughters in the dust, doing the bare minimum for them.  Some parents in third world countries won't even allow their daughters to attend school bc they're jealous that if they fund their daughters education,  she'll get married  and help her husband and his family have a better life.

all_comments.text: Thank you for giving all the details (names etc) and the subtitles are fantastic! üôè‚ù§Ô∏è This is a tough but nuanced story with great acting. Two characters who love deeply despite hurting each other. Grey characters (neither lead is all good or all bad). Both are victims of circumstances, but also perpetrators. The tension was consistent throughout, and I was riveted. 10/10 for me, but it will not appeal to everyone. The actors had me so invested I bawled at the end, but the last screen shot helped- the way her visage turned around and smiled, indicated a "yes" in answer to the ML's voice-over question.

all_comments.text:

all_comments.video_title: [MULTI SUB] Forgiveness for Love„ÄêFull„ÄëAfter backstabbing my ex, he became a bossy CEO | Drama Zone
all_comments.text:
‚Äã@stephanien6237 (Spoilers Below!) Well, I can see the story from both of their points of view. To be clear, I'm not condoning the actions of either lead, but I can understand the drive behind them. I'll focus on the ML's side since it seems you already empathized well with the FL. She shattered his heart and put him through hell. He even had a line that was something like wanting to 'bring her into hell with him' because he was still feeling tormented by her betrayal of their love. Her metaphorically backstabbing him by giving false testimony and having him sent to jail (where he's almost truly stabbed to death) for a murder he did not commit, was completely unexpected to him. He never knows until near the end of the story that she did it to save her mom. As they start crossing paths again I can see his deep bitterness, but also his growing desperation for her love- to have her show that at least some part of what he thought they once shared was real.

The ML is not inherently cruel (the flashbacks show the huge contrast in demeanor), circumstances have influenced him to grow hard, cold, bitter, and ruthless. Throughout the story his inner turmoil is apparent, at least it was to me. His resolve for revenge softens over time despite his hurts. That, his desperation for her to love him back, and his eventual decision to forgive everything, indicates how strongly he feels about her.

The FL also continues to hide and then lie about their child (I can understand that she's afraid of the daughter being taken away or being used against her, but I can also see the argument that telling him at some point sooner could have greatly sped up her medical care because the ML could afford it. So covering up the truth for so long technically hurts the daughter as well as the ML, especially since the daughter wants a father and already gets along well with the ML).

The FL herself never blames the ML. She's never stopped loving him, but she holds that back and doesn't show it. When the ML agrees to walk away and never see her again, she regrets it and says to herself, "Even if it's hate, I don't want to lose you". Though at that point he doesn't hate her anymore, that's why he lets her go.

At the end, it seemed that things were heading in the direction of mending and, had the FL not had a terminal illness, the two of them and their daughter could have healed emotional wounds over time and been able to grow into a happy family.

Life was hard for both of them. Some of that instigated by outside forces and circumstances, some through misunderstandings, and some due to their own perceptions, decisions, and actions. I just wished for everybody's suffering to ease.

I thought the FL's suicide seemed a bit contrived because it felt out of character, but that's another discussion.

all_comments.text:
Tho the ending is so heartbreaking and make me crying a river but i am very very satisfied with this kind of ending!!!!

The best retribution for a man like bo hanshi is like this, has no a future and cant amend his sins to that person he owe to the most!! A dead of his victim is best kind of revenge as he has no chance to show his apology, his sincerity that he's really regret it, and his way in atoning his sins. However he make those efforts, the feel cant reach to the dead person as they're already living in the different world.

But unfortunately, the writer doesnt show us how qiao yu's mom got killed. As the culprit is jiang wan, the vicious girl who will do anything to make bo hanshi marry her. Also there is no scene how bo hanshi will explaining to bo xiangshi (his daughter) about her mom is already died. As i believe the big contribution is bo hanshi, he make qiao yu drank so much alcohol to humaliate her and it lead her to hv a late stage of liver cancer. I wonder when xiangshi grow up, will she blame herself for craving a daddy back then but she had to pay with her mom died??

I thought that qiao family is really owing bo hanshi whatever the reason. But when i know that bo hanshi also has an ulterior motive for came to qiao family back then, i think that this drama had a dark plot. So bo hanshi is not that innocent as he used yuyu to cover his disguise. And he acted like yuyu owe him her life, not realized how his reason to get close to her in the first place. So this kind of ending is very serve him so well üëèüëè

all_comments.text:
I keep coming back to this story because, the way the ML has conveyed his regret is so deep. My heart breaks each time je cries in regret. Of all such stories that I have seen, this is the one guy who deserves a second chance. Because he doesn't ask for it like he deserves it, he asks for it only if she thinks he deserves it.

There is a scene where an uncle explains to the ML the truth of 5 years back, and he thinks about it. Even though there is a narration, realistically speaking, there is silence in that moment, because the ML is thinking about it. And his assistant is standing with him, and he knows that his boss is digesting some heavy truths. So he waits for his instructions. Beautiful scene!

Most  poignant was when he gave the diary of her parents with some notes and that of their students and second was when he showed the folder of the foundation's efforts to rescue rehabilate and help abducted/abandoned victims. all_comments.text: Personally, I think this is one of the rare ones where ML realizes his wrongs. Don't forget, he thought she drugged him. Who would be willing to be nice to some who did that to you? While he was cold and unfeeling to her, can you blame him? As for her side, she was also proud but strong enough to let go when she realized the marriage will never work. I also enjoy how he slowly learns the truth, regret, and does his best to make it up. He was even very respectful gong about it and didn't force her to forgive. They both learn to let go and forgive and try to give their feelings a chance.

all_comments.text: Love this story.  He did just enough mean things that made me angry, but not over the top.  She was composed throughout the drama, but never cold or distant.  Once he realized she wasn't the power hungry, gold digger who had drugged him, it slowly melted his heart.  I enjoyed seeing the dumbfounded look on his face when she returned the shares, the power she'd gained in the company and signed the non-disclosure agreement.  My only complaint was that the closed caption had more issues than usual.  I'd scene different clips and the CC were correct, where in this version, even her name would translate to many different words.

all_comments.text: Love this storyline because of all the heart-fluttering angsts of a ML who regrets his mistakes and pining over FL's forgiveness. The important part is ML's mistakes aren't written to be so abhorrent or obnoxious that any forgiveness by FL = stupidity. ML was left in the dark by both FL and his grandpa and thereafter all his actions were merely reasonable reactions based on the assumption that FL was just using him to be on top. all_comments.text:
I think most of us are used to the same old toxic abuse stories where the male lead is unforgivably abusive to the female lead for years and then gets a ridiculous, unearned and undeserved ‚Äúhappy ending‚Äù usually without any actual work or remorse on his side. Bonus points if he takes the knife of forgiveness instead of actually having to work to atone for his sins. üòÇ

This drama, although still having the FL stay and suffer for 5 years, actually spent 3/4 of the drama (from about 41:00 on) realizing he was wrong, showing honest remorse, having to deal with the fact that the FL doesn‚Äôt love him and may get with another guy, and having to work slowly to a) respect her and b) atone before he gets a second chance. And for once the male lead isn‚Äôt an arrogant controlling AH for the last 3/4 of the drama! Refreshing.

We are so used to the usual where 90% of drama is pure abuse followed by the male lead ‚Äúrealizing he was wrong‚Äù and calling it a ‚Äúmisunderstanding‚Äù followed by a barely-there apology and then 2 minutes later he takes the knife of forgiveness and all his sins are supposedly magically erased. üòÇüòÇüòÇ I hate those. It was nice to see a ML actually show some honest character development.

all_comments.video_title: [MULTI SUB] My Ex-husband's Regret„ÄêFull„ÄëStupid women live for love, now I live for myself|Drama Zone
all_comments.text:
Ps. Can you remind me why he loves her? I‚Äôm asking seriously because I can absolutely understand why he would feel guilt and shame for mistreating her when he finds out the truth (even though he never once felt bad for mistreating her during their 5 year marriage‚Äîwhich suggests he is not a decent human being). But given that he never actually got to know her, why did he love her?

I feel like they never really had a chance to connect as people. He just was an arrogant AH, she divorced him and left, he finally found out the truth (something he never bothered to figure out before then), and suddenly he feels bad so he thinks he now loves her?

Or maybe he missed all the comforts she gave him that he didn‚Äôt realize (like the soup). That‚Äôs not love.

all_comments.text: @stephanien6237 if you agree with me that love is indeed has no boundaries then you will understand Wang Hao Zen ML feelings towards Cai Cai Yun FL at the end .He never hates her from the beginning he just misunderstood her for being a scheming woman .(drugging him, forcing him to marry her by his grandfather and a 10 percent shares from the company) not knowing the agreement between FL and his grandfather. FL agreed on the other hand because she like ML and she just want to repay his kindness and agreed to help ML within the span of five years. When ML find the truth he feels guilty and as you said he missed her when she left. I re watch it again because it is really a difficult plot to understand but it's worth watching. Love is infinite and sometimes unpredictable it defines this drama .

all_comments.text:
‚Å†‚Äã‚Å†@claudiodubas7781ooh. I love your phrase ‚Äúcharacter and morals are not like clothes for you to wear whenever you want‚Äù‚ÄîI will remember that!

I will say that at least in this drama (compared to 99% of the Chinese dramas I have seen) they at least tried to show the ML working to atone over weeks/months, not acting like the usual arrogant AH and assuming she has to obviously be with him‚Äîfor about 3/4 of the drama! I‚Äôm used to the usual 2 hours of toxic abuse, 5 minutes of the male lead figuring out the truth, and then a half-hearted apology because of the ‚Äúmisunderstanding‚Äù and zero accountability or atonement by him, and then he gets a ridiculous, unearned and undeserved happy ending, usually because of the knife of forgiveness trope.

Compared with these types of stories, this one was a lot better.

I still am not sure I believe he actually loves her‚Äîmore like he feels guilty over his abhorrent actions. (Which he would never have done if he were a decent human being in the first place.). But at least he worked for his second chance.

Precisely this, had enough of the dramas where one misunderstanding leds to divorce/break-up and then there is no turning back. I believe anyone can make mistakes and deserve one chance.

In this drama, ML had regret written all over his face, once he knew all past of FL, he really loves her now and wishes that she grants him a chance.

all_comments.text: @claudiodubas7781@claudiodubas7781  Obviously, regret is not; guilt is not. But it depends on how much one is willing to fight for. It is case by case basis. Both partners need some level of transformation. I will never say stay in a marriage that is not equal. It is a matter of whether both are trying and can their marriage be saved. In most abuse cases, one ends up being a victim and just accepts it and never understands that something is wrong to begin with it. Would need outside help. So there's no help there. But a lot of marriages could be saved just by improving communication.

all_comments.text:
Can we start having some dramas where the male lead is emotionally and verbally abused by the all powerful female lead for 2.5 hours and then they expect us to think it‚Äôs a happy ending because he takes her back at the end? üòÇüòÇ
Because it‚Äôs getting really ridiculous and overdone to have a constant theme of women accepting abuse from their husbands. What a disgusting misogynistic message.

This male lead did NOT deserve a second chance. He spent 5 years degrading and humiliating the female lead. His arrogance made it so that he didn‚Äôt even bother to find out the truth 5 years ago but instead he waited until she left to even investigate. He never gave one thought to her wants, her needs, her background her feelings. He doesn‚Äôt just get to say ‚Äúoops, my bad! Now take me back‚ÄùüòÇüòÇüòÇ

I don‚Äôt believe for one second that he actually loves her. I can believe he may feel guilty but that isn‚Äôt love. You have to actually get to know someone to love them and he never bothered. Pretending to love her is ridiculous.

Also, I have almost no idea why she liked, much less loved, him in the past. But any love she might have once felt for him was surely eroded and gone after 5 years of emotional abuse. She deserves happiness and she definitely won‚Äôt get it with such an arrogant, self centered asshole like him.

all_comments.text:
Spoiler******

This is my third or fourth time watching this drama. This was a beautiful emotional drama. When I initially watched it the first time I felt that the ml still didn‚Äôt deserve her in the end. I saw that he had an unspoken concern for her but he never clarified anything to her. He let others bully her and he himself bullied her for five years. The fl was kidnapped and the ml‚Äôs grandfather helped her with her education and sponsored her. Later she agreed to help the grandfather and she literally was repaying them for the kindness she received. From her perspective she begged for food and money when she was younger so when she was sponsored, she was beyond great full. In between she fell for the ml for whatever reason. The fl character was sweet and fierce and smart. I love how the ML‚Äôs family loved the fl and even the mom slapped her son after he told her that he likes the fl after their divorce. Everyone around him told him to not disturb the fl. However the ml was like no until she finds her partner, he hopes that he can be there for her. He started to look at what she likes and needs and anything to do with her. It took a long time for the fl to even open up to the ml. He worked hard for her but nothing compared to what she endured for those five years. In the end she accepted him because of his efforts and she still loved him even though she tried to move forward in her life. I loved the story and it kept me glued to the screen so I like coming to this drama to watch it. ‚ù§

all_comments.video_title: [MULTI SUB] Sign Here, My Love„ÄêFull„ÄëSigned divorce papers with one hand, and held his with the other
all_comments.text:
I watched another version of this a while ago and remember enjoying it. This one is off to a really good start. I like the way these actors are playing the roles. Very dynamic.

The ML's doctor friend is definitely the smartest, attentive and most insightful one in the bunch. I love how he sits back and just enjoys the show going on around him. ü§£

1:53:10 I'm scared to say it and jinx it (knocking on wood) but I've loved everything about this drama so far. Everything the leads has done is exactly what I'd hoped they would do. It's been unbelievably satisfying and entertaining. What worries me is that there's so much more left to go, which means they can screw the story up tremendously. It's extremely rare that I haven't been let down. This version of the story has been following the other version I saw closely enough but in better detail. It's like a major upgrade of the script (and I really liked the other version already as it was). The runtime here is a lot longer but it definitely doesn't feel slow at all. The pacing, surprisingly, is just right. I hope like hell this continues to be great and doesn't become another disappointment.

2:57:25 Uh oh! I think they may be heading in a direction of the first and only thing I may end up disliking about this drama - a dumb ass noble sacrifice!!! I hope they don't do it. Writing this good doesn't need to be tainted by such stupidity. She should know better than to make decisions for him. BUT, the headline for this video makes it seem like it's coming. UGH! Say it isn't so!! This drama has literally been perfect so far for me.

3:00:00 This FL and this drama sure is doing its best not to let us down! Seeing her try to talk him through the loss without telling him what's going on, trying to make sure he won't blindly follow her was just so ON POINT! It's not the normal noble idiocy. It's in line with the behavior of the FL all along, which is really all I was hoping for. Lord I LOVE this dang drama!!!

Trauma and nightmares every night. Miss Lin who has suffered since she was young, must also accept her fate with terminal cancer. Worse, they both found happiness in the last moments of their lives. all_comments.text:
I found myself constantly frustrated by the FL and her hesitation, her inability to form a complete sentence and communicate with the ML who throughout the entire show was reaching out and attempting to establish a line of connection. I was so annoyed honestly. She was capable of responding and chose not to. I get it, her family had her dad in the hospital hostage. She needed money for the bill and so she took their crap. Hated it. But I understand, unfortunately, when you grow up alone, discarded, demeaned, humiliated, repeatedly told you‚Äôre worthless and treated as expendable the reality is your temperament and personality will give us our FL on a platter. Anyway, I have 45 min left on this. Maybe it suddenly gets super romantic, there‚Äôs a mutual kiss or two and they fall in love, learn to communicate and meet each other in the middle where they live happily ever after. Lesson: Honest Communication is key with your partner.

Update: I‚Äôm not finishing this. I‚Äôm over analyzing this damn show, I hate it here lol. She‚Äôs so evasive. Grow up. The ML deserved better. She was childish in my opinion. The evasiveness was a choice. She was a coward up until where I drop it. Yes it‚Äôs that serious.

all_comments.video_title: [MULTI SUB] Blind in Love„ÄêFull„ÄëBlind CEO and Disguised Wife, True Love in Conspiracy | Drama Zone
all_comments.text:
5 out of 5 stars. Comedy/Drama. Nit much sizzling romance but it's a story of ML who is blind via emotional trauma and a spunky FL and both stubborn and opposites of each other. ML starts off rude, arrogant and aloof and thinks she's like all women, vain and greedy for money. Of course people around him constantly put him and his blindness as being undesirable and useless. FL is direct and impulsive being bullied into marriage as he's a higher social status and
rich. The father is being hostage as he's in a coma and they use him to extort money from her.
The two slowly start to trust each other though ML iis suspicious of her all the time. His assistant provides comedy relief. There's an illegitimate heir conspiring to take over the company and force ML out. It's a good and satisfying end.

I don‚Äôt know, both ML and FL are ok, especially ML. But the way they build the FL character in the beginning somehow makes me feel uncomfortable. Like if you have a good heart (willing to sacrifice yourself to save your papa), you normally have a good sense of sympathy too. Even though ML in the beginning had a smeared mouth, but he showed up helping you the next day after you guys got the certificate, and fell down in front of everyone while trying to protect you. At least showing a bit of caring and worrying, but she‚Äôs lack of it. He bumped into the taxi, she just laughed and he had to asked her for help üòÖ. It happened more than once. Someone blind has to stand up for you and all you care is his word not his action.
And again, it‚Äôs so strange that they build the female character in most of the ‚Äúmarried first loved later‚Äù dramas is they claimed the ML perverted when they hinted something related to marriage obligation but it‚Äôs obviously that it‚Äôs normal for anyone who gets married wants to do it. Actually you can try to avoid it because you‚Äôre not willing, but you can‚Äôt claim they‚Äôre perverted for it.

all_comments.text: I wasn't a fan of FL, (the character not the actress, great acting!) but I loved the drama! Well, she was constantly over the top and dramatic. She knew ML was mentally ill but she always called him crazy and said mean things to provoke or piss him off. I totally understand that it can be exhausting to have an obsessed person around you but she didn't handle it like the 28 yo grown woman she's supposed to be. Except that being kind of a stalker, he never mistreated her, on the contrary but she acted like he did something unforgivable to her. 10 years later, she should‚Äôve realized that the problem was with her former bullies, not him. I even thought she lost her memories with him because of trauma from her bullying, because she was too hard on him. Again, she wasn't in an easy position, but she should‚Äôve avoided unnecessary drama like the time he took too much medication after she provoked him; he could‚Äôve died, and she would have regretted it greatly, but too late. Good thing she apologized for her past behavior at school though.

It's like there are no other men in the world except for the main lead. She obviously did not know what love meant. Just like the male lead.
The impact of a drama like this where it is psychological abuse can't be seen as a romance , why do I say that because this drama highlights what a woman should not put up with and what a man who is using a woman looks like. So really this should be a lesson to the women out there that this is what you avoid at all costs, because no man is worth it, or in some cases, no woman. Female lead obviously has no self-love nor does she know how to respect herself. Although she did try to leave him and that is how this drama should have ended. The male lead mother had an unnatural hold over her son. The son was weak and had no backbone to oppose his mother who was an utterly disgusting woman that used disgusting ways to hurt anyone that came into contact with her son that she did not like. She was a criminal, but she did not pay the price for her criminal activities.
At the end that they should get married is a messed up scenario. To get married to a man who emotionally used and abused you means he has already done it once and got away with it by saying," I'm sorry" he will be fully aware that he can do this as much as he likes to you because he can get away with it.

Wow a powerful assessment and great lesson to all.  This is what the C dramas like to portray as the norm in relationships -- and they promote such types of behavior as the norm for men and women.  Terrible.

all_comments.text: I came for a change of scenery from the normal short drama series, can't say I was disappointed. A problem I have with a good majority of the series is that they have no HIPAA laws in place. The medical staff never have any qualms about releasing anyone's medical history. I like the supernatural aspect of the drama as I'm into shows of that nature. I wasn't wholeheartedly disappointed with the ending like most of these series leave me, my overall rating 9/10

all_comments.video_title: [MULTI SUB] Girl, You're My Savior„ÄêFull„ÄëFairy travels in modern times to her beloved man| Drama Zone
all_comments.text: You do realize HIPAA is a US law and not a global one, right? Privacy and protection laws differ from country to country. China has completely different laws from the US, especially with it being a communist country. I'm sure they protect the rights of their people just the same but the way they go about it may be different. I'm not saying that ANY realistic laws are applied to this or any other drama. I also haven't even watched this yet. I just saw your comment and wanted to point out that expecting the laws of one country to be depicted in the dramas of another country is flawed.

all_comments.text: @kaalston26 That may be true, but I'm sure they have some sort of privacy and protection law is all I'm saying. So while I do appreciate the response, my view is the same nonetheless

this is really a very sweet drama, ML is amazingly great to her - I'm really happy that writers didn't make a mess with that female teacher Ms. Gu and ML, they kept it clean - - even when I think she had feelings for him, she was decent and didn't try anything to provoke him... It really is a good one....
3:05:18 - omg, this scene brought tears to my eyes - her brother really cares for her, even with his careless appearance, he loves her very much - - -
Still think the end was way too short and they needed time to show their love for each other with some time at the end, but doesn't surprise me at all, since most short dramas end with two seconds of happiness and two or tree hours of arguments or non-sense drama -- - - this was a little long with the same back and forth non-sense, but still I liked it.... had to fast-forward some scenes, but still - - -

all_comments.video_title: [MULTI SUB] The Professor My Husband„ÄêFull„ÄëFortune says you're the one, so says my heart | Drama Zone
all_comments.text: A very sweet, gentle and lovely drama. Perhaps a little on the long side as the story progresses very slowly with little skinship between the leads, no high tension points, no negative characters (except one jealous classmate but that character was ineffective) and a dreamlike, meandering pace. The ML is a lovely 'green flag'. The FL a sweet innocent girl with cutsie little girlfriends who stand by her. The family on both sides are supportive & loving. You could safely let you children watch this one. No physical violence, no physical bullying of the FL (some cyber but that's sorted immediately), no love rivals, just a gentle slow burn story with two sweet leads.

Initially i dont understand why after already get married to her crush fl is still very defensive towards ml. Then when she explain near the end, the reason why she get angry is because her memories of him count to 11 years and he didnt even notice, she fell angry and unfair because she already like him for a long time but he just started to like her not that long.
I love this perspective, they both each other 1st love but started at different timelines. I like the story didnt suddenly intentionally shows the ml also like her way back too. That is why their connection is special. The moment the man notice her at her failed blind date he instantly felt the connection.
